We booked 2 rooms at their sister hotel at Eagle's Nest & paid in Advance to avoid any hassle since we were arriving late in the evening. 
Once we arrived tired from all days driving, the reception guy's first words were "you guys won't make it to the other hotel". Instead of welcoming they started to spit their lies about it's too hard to climb down the stairs for women at this hour & bla bla bla what not. Lies after lies after lies! 

After wasting our 1 hour & we insisting that we will go anyways since we had booked and paid for the duplex rooms. Finally they agreed to take us but just to give us more trouble & waste more of our time they had turned off all the lamps on the stairways so we wouldn't be able to go down. 
Luckily we had our own torch lights & decided to go down with only 2 people since by that time we already had suspected that they had given out our rooms to someone else. 

Long story short they took us through the hardest route to burn us just so we will not argue & stay at another horrible scary motel that nobody else was staying at. 

At the end we asked them to refund us the amount we paid & they refused to do so & not only that they threatened us with the consequences if we wouldn't leave. 

We ended up staying at the Serena hotel which we should've booked in the first place. 

I believe in supporting the local businesses but after this experience I'd recommend Boycotting this hotel to save your time, money and harrassment. You can tell the idea behind it is artistic, creative, luxury-resort oriented but somehow fell into the wrong hands. Starting with the room: nicely done but not maintained. No room service. Tv in our room did not work. Kept asking for someone to come and fix it for two nights but no one came. Then the balcony's light (which offers a heavenly view of the valley and the mountains) did not have the operating switch within the room??!! (strange). Called the reception to have it switched off - no one did that and the light remained on throughout our stay (3 days)!
My biggest issue was with the food! There is no nearby cafe for dinner (Eagle's Nest is wayyyy up a mountain), so if interested for dining out you have to go quite a way down - at the end of the day, everyone is too tired to do that. So from what I could gather hotel residents HAD to take dinner in its dining hall. And that is where the flaws show through. Food takes ages to arrive. Both nights we waited nearly 2 and more hours for as few as 4 dishes. Then very little serving per plate order. Lastly -pathetic food! We tried all the local dishes in other areas of GB as well and all tasted so much better. This is where they ought to have focused more and did not bother!
Surprisingly, the staff is mostly lounging about on the steps to the reception, reminds one of walking in an urban city bazaar, wary of leery eyed guys. Which is strange, as the GB locals are the sweetest, friendliest and quite egalitarian people.
The hotel seems to be surviving because of the view it offers but otherwise I do not think it will survive for long unless if the owners sit up and take notice.","user":{"user_id":"B44735D4FE3C39030C35AF454ABBBF3C","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"46","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"6","hotel_reviews":"15","attraction_reviews":"25","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"17","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"FDKamal","user_location":{"name":"Peshawar, Pakistan","id":"295412"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/0b/45/26/67/fdkamal.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-f/0b/45/26/67/fdkamal.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.B44735D4FE3C39030C35AF454ABBBF3C","points":"0","created_time":"2015-06-15T09:47:05-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Recommended for just the View","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Sleep Quality","value":"3"},{"name":"Cleanliness","value":"3"},{"name":"Service","value":"1"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false},{"id":"689343937","lang":"en","location_id":"1027139","published_date":"2019-07-13T16:45:06-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g469409-d1027139-r689343937-Eagle_s_Nest_Hotel-Hunza_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review689343937","travel_date":"2019-06","text":"When ever I visited hunza always stayed in eagle nest because the veiw and service of the hotel is amazing. This local Shangrila is a located on a rise overlooking the Indus river below. 

It is a local, low-rise, sand-coloured hotel with quaint, cave-like rooms: the tables, chairs, bed stand are moulded rather than being separate pieces. Bright ethnic colours and fabic decorate the rooms, which have an unusual ventilator fan instead of air-conditioning for cooling.  The bathroom is covered in slate and can be a bit dark.  

There's an outdoor garden with a view overlooking the river and mountains across the river.  Dining area is long with glass windows on one side. 

The hotel is located away from the main town, but there are small hotels and restaurants within walking distance.  The main draw of this hotel is its location by the river and its local quaint-ness.

As at September 2018, there is some concern about security in the Chilas area, and the security guard won't let foreigners wander out of the hotel grounds unaccompanied by a guide.","user":{"user_id":"FD7FBA15378698541BADE5C784091E53","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"272","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"48","hotel_reviews":"167","attraction_reviews":"57","helpful_votes":"205","photos_count":"24","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"Leeyuk","user_location":{"name":"Kuala Lumpur","id":null},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/e6/ea/default-avatar-2020-54.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/e6/ea/default-avatar-2020-54.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.FD7FBA15378698541BADE5C784091E53","points":"0","created_time":"2006-09-22T02:18:37-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Quaint and Engaging","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Value","value":"4"},{"name":"Location","value":"4"},{"name":"Service","value":"3"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false},{"id":"602344421","lang":"en","location_id":"6847276","published_date":"2018-08-03T03:57:36-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"2","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g1652424-d6847276-r602344421-Shangrila_Resort_Hotel_Chilas-Chilas_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review602344421","travel_date":"2018-06","text":"Shangrila resort hotel Chilas is a very impressive location on the banks of mighty River The Indus. We had travelled from skardu to Hunza & had stayed at the Serena’s in Khaplu & Shiger. Hence, the expectations from the Serena in Hunza. 
Upon arrival we were checked in to a super tiny room that couldn’t even fit our luggage in. We had to choose between walking around the bed or keeping our luggage. We requested for a bigger room and offered to pay for an upgrade but we were told there are only two deluxe rooms on the whole property which were completely booked. 
After complaining to them about their room & Internet, they gave us an excuse saying that since they can’t keep up to serena standards, they have named it Serena In. They are still charging the same price as Serena though. 
Nothing is good at this place. Don’t expect good food, services or hospitality. The people are reception don’t know how to deal with their clients & they have an excuse for everything. They are charging so much but can’t even provide good internet. On top of that, you don’t get good phone service in the area. 
This place only has a good view. That is all. But you can find that in many places in Hunza. 
I won’t recommend anyone to stay here and spend so much. name: Hunza Darbar Hotel
reviews:
[{"id":"812265242","lang":"en","location_id":"12419672","published_date":"2021-09-28T21:50:43-04:00","published_platform":"Mobile","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g469409-d12419672-r812265242-Hunza_Darbar_Hotel-Hunza_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review812265242","travel_date":"2021-01","text":"There are many good hotels in Hunza Darbar Hotel is also one of them. It is very beautiful, neat & clean with trained, humble & helpful staff. The food specially breakfast is also very delicious  and thanks of Mr. Maqbool for choosing us to stay in this hotel. It is situated in the heart of KarimAbad (Central Hunza). Hunza is a very beautiful valley you should must visit once in a life. 
Mr. Maqbool is Best Of The Best Tour Operator & Tour Guide in Hunza & Pakistan. We spent 2 weeks with him in Pakistan & Hunza. He arranged our Trip and guided us in Pakistan. He is very Knowledgeable, polite, flexible, punctual, honest. We can frankly say that he is the university of history & Encyclopedia of Pakistan. name: Hunza View Hotel
reviews:
[{"id":"769044221","lang":"en","location_id":"1085825","published_date":"2020-09-06T05:53:29-04:00","published_platform":"Mobile","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g7349278-d1085825-r769044221-Hunza_View_Hotel-Karimabad_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review769044221","travel_date":"2020-08","text":"Recently in August 2020 I visited Hunza, Gilgit Baltistan with a group of 23 people. There I stayed at Hunza view hotel.

Hunza view hotel. It is the all in one package a visitor like me could have wished for. Starting with it’s location, the hotel is surrounded by beautiful mountains from all sides. The view from the hotel is breathtaking and the hotel itself is so beautiful that you don’t have to go any where else. It has a lush green garden with trees of apple, peach, grapes and apricot.
The hotel has very sophisticated rooms by which I am pretty much satisfied. On to the management and hospitality. The hotel has a very good staff that is present at your service. Their Manager, Abbas is a hospitable, cooperative, friendly and a humble person who will always be there to assist you and give you the best piece of advice regarding your visit. The hotel also has it’s own parking area. 

But there are some areas where Hunza view hotel needs improvement. One of the area is cleaning, Although they provide you with the cleanings facility but it can only be done in the morning. It’s not 24/7. The other area is WiFi, the hotel has a weak WiFi connection and it gets difficult for the tourist to stay connected with the outside world. The alternative is to buy there local Sim network (SCOM).

Everything has it’s pros and cons but at the end of the day Hunza view hotel is my strongest recommendation to the people visiting Hunza, Gilgit It is the first hotel you would find as you enter into the steep road into Karimabad. 
Every room has its own balcony with stunning view on both sides. And there are common balconies on each wing of the hotel. So you have the best chance of capturing the beauty of Hunza Valley from this hotel.

Plus there is a garden with grapevines where you can just sit and enjoy the serene natural landscape and the lush greenery of Hunza Valley below. I was there in fall and simply the view is awesome!

At night in fall the temperature could drop to minus 4C. There was no heater in my room and hot water was very limited to certain hours in the morning. Fortunately, I had 2 warm blankets for the 3 nights I stayed here and I woke up at 5 am to get the first ration of hot water. 

Other amenities like a TV which I could live without. You would need to ask for housekeeping but I think it was not available at his hotel. I had to ask for a fresh towel. 

Not sure about cafeteria or restaurant in this hotel as my room was on the first floor. It looked like there was a small cafe on the third floor.

The lobby was quite impressive with a common TV room for guests and on the notice boards on the wall, you could find information about tours and day trips to around.Hunza Valley.

There was also a small souvenir shop next to the main entrance where you could get some local produce and sundries like mineral water etc.","user":{"user_id":"B442BCAEB0CF4924CF685AC7ABA4235F","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"171","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"23","hotel_reviews":"51","attraction_reviews":"97","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"194","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"marcofahmey","user_location":{"name":"Sao Paulo, SP","id":"303631"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/12/50/52/c7/marcofahmey.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-f/12/50/52/c7/marcofahmey.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.B442BCAEB0CF4924CF685AC7ABA4235F","points":"0","created_time":"2016-02-13T04:54:54-0500","locale":"en_MY"},"title":"A budget hotel with stunning views of the 5 peaks surrounding Hunza Valley","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Value","value":"3"},{"name":"Cleanliness","value":"2"},{"name":"Service","value":"3"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false}]

name: Caravanserai Hunza
reviews: [{"id":"810505183","lang":"en","location_id":"23613724","published_date":"2021-09-17T22:08:11-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"4","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g19681869-d23613724-r810505183-Caravanserai_Hunza-Ganish_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review810505183","travel_date":"2021-09","text":"I have been a hotelier all my life.  Sulking for some common sense shown in renovating a hotel specially at hill stations of Pakistan. You usually see the same dirty run of the mill multi coloured badly maintained production line joints, having business pouring in, no one bothers about hygiene courtesy or even essential guest services. Fancy chinese lights and typical cliches learnt from mediocre hospitality outlets govern the sector. In short no one even reaches the minimal baseline standards of a resort.\n\nI was very pleasantly surprised to see Caravanserai Ganish Hunza.  Absolute necessary equipment in rooms. Tidy clean spacious washrooms, courteous staff who doesnt have one eye on your pocket with a plastic smile. Nice comfortable beds with spring matresses. Spacious washrooms and individualised attention makes it stand out of the rest, instantly. With minor fine tuning it certainly is a neat and tidy resort well recommended for finicky families for comfort hygiene selfless guest services space and location. Specially when you are watching your budget.   Well done Caravanserai! If you keep it up with a little fine tuning, you will be the most sought resort needing more rooms before you know it.Good Luck.","user":{"user_id":"1396916685828EB202B0366E313E2C29","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"1","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"0","hotel_reviews":"1","attraction_reviews":"0","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"0","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"AliH3719","user_location":{"name":null,"id":null},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/06/f2/13/6d/ali-h.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-s/06/f2/13/6d/ali-h.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.1396916685828EB202B0366E313E2C29","points":"0","created_time":"2013-09-23T02:08:19-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Review from a Hitelier","owner_response":null,"subratings":[],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false}]

This local Shangrila is a located on a rise overlooking the Indus river below. 

It is a local, low-rise, sand-coloured hotel with quaint, cave-like rooms: the tables, chairs, bed stand are moulded rather than being separate pieces. Bright ethnic colours and fabic decorate the rooms, which have an unusual ventilator fan instead of air-conditioning for cooling.  The bathroom is covered in slate and can be a bit dark.  

There's an outdoor garden with a view overlooking the river and mountains across the river.  Dining area is long with glass windows on one side. 

The hotel is located away from the main town, but there are small hotels and restaurants within walking distance.  The main draw of this hotel is its location by the river and its local quaint-ness.

As at September 2018, there is some concern about security in the Chilas area, and the security guard won't let foreigners wander out of the hotel grounds unaccompanied by a guide.","user":{"user_id":"FD7FBA15378698541BADE5C784091E53","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"272","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"48","hotel_reviews":"167","attraction_reviews":"57","helpful_votes":"205","photos_count":"24","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"Leeyuk","user_location":{"name":"Kuala Lumpur","id":null},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/e6/ea/default-avatar-2020-54.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/e6/ea/default-avatar-2020-54.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.FD7FBA15378698541BADE5C784091E53","points":"0","created_time":"2006-09-22T02:18:37-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Quaint and Engaging","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Value","value":"4"},{"name":"Location","value":"4"},{"name":"Service","value":"3"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false},{"id":"602344421","lang":"en","location_id":"6847276","published_date":"2018-08-03T03:57:36-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"2","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g1652424-d6847276-r602344421-Shangrila_Resort_Hotel_Chilas-Chilas_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review602344421","travel_date":"2018-06","text":"Shangrila resort hotel Chilas is a very impressive location on the banks of mighty River The Indus. reviews:
[{"id":"809909102","lang":"en","location_id":"23555099","published_date":"2021-09-14T01:38:33-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"2","type":"review","helpful_votes":"1","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g317119-d23555099-r809909102-Byarsa_Hotel-Skardu_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review809909102","travel_date":"2021-09","text":"Pros
"Aesthetic" (arguably obnoxious) interior design
20 minutes away from the airport
Generally clean 

Cons
Everything else, notably -
Slow, nonchalant, often non-existent response to complaints (we had many). Seemingly understaffed.
Little to no storage in room/bathroom.
Absurd placement of electrical outlets.
Frequent electricity, water and wifi outages.
Subpar food.
Strange smells in hallways and some rooms.
Missing basic amenities such as laundry services.
No privacy on your private balcony. Every conversation in every room can be heard in the corridors.
No elevator!!! Good luck with your penthouse on the 5th floor.
Strange penny-pinching policies. Dining on the rooftop costs extra. Airport pick/drop costs extra.
The people of Skardu are some of the most welcoming, helpful and hospitable people you will ever meet, yet the owners have decided against hiring any locals. Staff at other hotels will go above and beyond, but the Byarsa "family" MIGHT do the bare minimum.
Barely any view of the scenery. There is about 10 square feet of greenery on the entire property, half of which is used up by ugly fountains rather than seating for guests. Surrounded by grey walls, you'll forget you're in one of the most beautiful areas of Pakistan.
Verdict:
Worth noting that this is a new hotel and the staff is learning the ropes. Management, however, has to set their priorities straight. Your comfort is the last thing on their mind. This is a luxury hotel ONLY by design.
If you're been swayed by their artsy Instagram page, just come here for lunch and take all the pictures you want. They might give you a tour of the rooms as well so you'll get what you want for your Instagram. PLEASE SAVE YOUR TIME AND MONEY. Go to any other hotel if you want to experience what Skardu has to offer.","user":{"user_id":"EDFB9B028F34DF56CF6C3F97CF3D2649","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"2","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"0","hotel_reviews":"2","attraction_reviews":"0","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"0","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"abbasaM5277GA","user_location":{"name":null,"id":null},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/e7/7b/default-avatar-2020-56.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/e7/7b/default-avatar-2020-56.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.EDFB9B028F34DF56CF6C3F97CF3D2649","points":"0","created_time":"2021-09-13T16:00:34-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Luxurious only on Instagram","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Sleep Quality","value":"3"},{"name":"Cleanliness","value":"5"},{"name":"Service","value":"2"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false},{"id":"801444311","lang":"en","location_id":"23555099","published_date":"2021-08-02T23:05:43-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"4","type":"review","helpful_votes":"2","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g317119-d23555099-r801444311-Byarsa_Hotel-Skardu_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review801444311","travel_date":"2021-07","text":"Stayed here 3 nights. width":"250","height":"188"}}}]},{"id":"763639566","lang":"en","location_id":"17410359","published_date":"2020-08-08T00:08:52-04:00","published_platform":"Mobile","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g317119-d17410359-r763639566-Mountain_Lodge_Skardu-Skardu_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review763639566","travel_date":"2020-08","text":"Mountain View Lodge is one of the first hotels you will encounter in Skardu when arriving from Deosai Plains. It is perched on a hill top, facing the Skardu mountains and a city below. And to start off, the view is stunning, especially during the evenings and mornings. At night, you will enjoy the twinkle of the city lights in the distance, and the stars above. There is little light pollution so the starry nights are quite incredible, especially for city folk. 

Now, since this is Northern Pakistan, you have to manage your expectations a bit. There are many ways this hotel surpasses your expectations, and a couple of ways it might not. I’ll list my pros below:
Pros:
1. The grounds are beautiful. There is a lhot of love that’s gone into designing this hotel. Each room has a balcony that faces the mountains. There are multiple gazebos sitting amongst vibrant gardens. There is a small apricot tree farm area in the back. There is unique Balochi style seating upstairs with cushions where you can sit and eat or just relax and stare at the stars. It’s lined with turf but was surprisingly romantic and comfortable for me and my husband. There are lots of nooks and crannies to explore as well, it’s an open layout with lots of private areas that families and couples will enjoy.
2. The food is amazing, definitely suggest visiting the restaurant and trying the chicken handi with their local roti. Creamy and delicious! The food came out relatively quickly. Prices are reasonable, especially if you are an international traveler, it’s dirt cheap.
3. The hotel is new and well maintained. The hotel opened in May 2019. The rooms are clean, the grounds are in excellent condition, no maintenance issues in our room. There is still some small areas in the back that are being completed and should add to the hotel’s allure once finished.
4. The room is large and comfortable with basic amenities. Our room had a comfortable bed, dresser, small flat-screen TV, a nice balcony, small seating area and a clean bathroom with lots of hot water. 
5. The staff is great and helpful. The on-site manager was terrific at suggesting lots of activities in the area and checked up on us to make sure we were comfortable. The bell boy that took our luggage to the room and the waitstaff at the restaurant were very polite and responsive.
6. The view! The view! The view! The Mountain Views are amazing and one of the best in the area. Be ready for warm hues in the morning and purple and blue hues at sunset. This alone is worth the price of the hotel.

A few things to consider
1. This place has internet that’s good enough to check email, and surf the web. I would not rely on it for video streaming, but in Skardu you will be hard-pressed to find true high-speed Internet. Also, the Internet gets better in the rooms closer to the lobby area. This may change as the hotel continues to develop.
2. There is no A/C in the rooms, but Skardu tends to be a chilly place even in the summers so one is not needed. Don’t be alarmed.
3. You are further away from the main city area with bazaars. This isn’t an issue if you have your own car and since the hotel has a full restaurant.
4. In order to obtain the best price, I would call the hotel directly. You will be able to score a much better deal this way. You may also mention that Ranya gave you a referral. I do not get anything out of it, but they offer a referral discount as well. 

Overall a great value and a true gem that I would love to stay at again.","user":{"user_id":"0AA7DD97E42704F650A18C765F961A0D","type":"user","first_name":"Ranya","last_initial":"K","name":"Ranya K","reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"14","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"3","hotel_reviews":"10","attraction_reviews":"1","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"0","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"Ranya K","user_location":{"name":null,"id":null},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/05/22/7c/c7/ranya-k.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-s/05/22/7c/c7/ranya-k.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.0AA7DD97E42704F650A18C765F961A0D","points":"0","created_time":"2007-09-24T04:29:59-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Incredible views, very romantic, a hidden gem for families and couples","owner_response":null,"subratings":[],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false}]

Guest house is situated in Jafferabad Town on Main Karakoram Highway. It is located in Nagar Valley and ideal place to stay .Hunza is around 40 mins ahead if you are coming from Gilgit. 
Owners are very helpful. They try to accommodate everyone, groups, couples, solo travellers etc. 
It's has an excellent view of the Rakaposhi and other mountains. Rakaposhi view point is at 10 mins drive. Naltar valley is also close by. Around 10 km of this place their are multiple view points and locations of great interest. 
It's much much better to stay in Nagar because it not touristy and one can enjoy the serenity and tranquility.
Rates are affordable and very reasonable. 
Highly recommended.","user":{"user_id":"D66B85CA96D145EE39A92E7543A49171","type":"user","first_name":"Muhammad","last_initial":"M","name":"Muhammad M","reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"1","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"0","hotel_reviews":"1","attraction_reviews":"0","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"0","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"Muhammad M","user_location":{"name":"Karachi, Pakistan","id":"295414"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/77/ae/default-avatar-2020-2.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/77/ae/default-avatar-2020-2.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.D66B85CA96D145EE39A92E7543A49171","points":"0","created_time":"2015-08-04T17:55:16-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Best Place to Stay in Nagar Valley","owner_response":{"id":"675246015","lang":"en","published_date":"2019-05-20T07:15:25-04:00","connection":"Owner","responder":"HikalGuestHouse","text":"Thanks for your feedback. located on main Karakoram Highway in Nagar valley. Few shops and a fast food restaurant located at few steps. 
This is the ideal location . Many activities and attractions are near. Better to stay here instead of Hunza . Nor very touristy neither commercial . Nagar has beautiful mountains,glaciers and streams. 
Located 1 hour from Gilgit. Easily approachable and Ample parking. From here Hunza is hardly at  distance of 45 mins. 
Rooms are big , cosy and spotless. Hot water available all the time. 
Staff is very hospitable and helping. 
Newly built and have a small garden with apple, pomegranate, Japanese fruit trees. 
It has an excellent view of Rakaposhi and other Mountains. 
Very Reasonable in price . 
Owners are 2 brothers and are very hospitable 
Highly recommended.","user":{"user_id":"EBFAE70A9F6C7FFC4116FADD70A2693D","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"102","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"15","hotel_reviews":"25","attraction_reviews":"62","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"78","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"Dentist_MM","user_location":{"name":"Karachi, Pakistan","id":"295414"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/19/f3/67/e4/dentist-mm.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-f/19/f3/67/e4/dentist-mm.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.EBFAE70A9F6C7FFC4116FADD70A2693D","points":"0","created_time":"2015-07-08T09:00:57-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Best Place to stay in Nagar / Hunza","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Location","value":"5"},{"name":"Cleanliness","value":"5"},{"name":"Service","value":"5"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false}]

name: Hotel Oasis International Gilgit
reviews: [{"id":"770841449","lang":"en","location_id":"19935093","published_date":"2020-09-18T01:14:26-04:00","published_platform":"Mobile","rating":"1","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g317116-d19935093-r770841449-Hotel_Oasis_International_Gilgit-Gilgit_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review770841449","travel_date":"2020-09","text":"I have never ever been in a hotel like this one. We had a booking for a deluxe room, with possibility to upgrade to an executive one. We arrived and were welcomed by a boy who said the manager, Shabbir was sleeping but he would wake him up. The hotel is STILL under construction and no other guests were present. Shabbir was utterly uninterested and showed us a dirty room with view of somebody’s dirty backyard. In the far distance we could catch a glimpse of the river. This was an unpleasant surprise after a long drive. I strongly advise travellers not to book this hotel, despite the wonderful reviews on the hotel’s website.","user":{"user_id":"6183E83D4BA2FBDC92F7FD0BF5A5974A","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"29","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"7","hotel_reviews":"14","attraction_reviews":"8","helpful_votes":"5","photos_count":"0","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"JacquelineIslamabad","user_location":{"name":"Islamabad Capital Territory, Pakistan","id":"3576452"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/e4/59/default-avatar-2020-49.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/e4/59/default-avatar-2020-49.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.6183E83D4BA2FBDC92F7FD0BF5A5974A","points":"0","created_time":"2013-04-22T03:40:41-0400","locale":"en_SG"},"title":"Fawlty Towers vs The Shining","owner_response":null,"subratings":[],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false}]

name: Hunza Hidden Palace
reviews: [{"id":"786249035","lang":"en","location_id":"17635676","published_date":"2021-04-10T08:15:30-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"2","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g469409-d17635676-r786249035-Hunza_Hidden_Palace-Hunza_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review786249035","travel_date":"2021-04","text":"this was the first time i visited hunza had great time over there staff at hunza Hidden palace was very nice but they miss guide and spread wrong image for local transporters in hunza which is actually very wrong and they over charge you for everything that is easily available for half the rates in hunza i checked other restaurants that were offering better rooms for lower rates plus they commit to provide hot water 24/7 i stayed for 3 days with my mother but there were not a single day when we get hot water i asked them to check for flight from gilgit to islamabad they said tickets available and price is 14k plus for single person and i went to pia website and it was available for 9k only then i ask them how much will the charge to drop me to gilgit they said  6k then i went to local reviews:
[{"id":"797810591","lang":"en","location_id":"1836772","published_date":"2021-07-18T04:07:19-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"2","type":"review","helpful_votes":"1","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g317119-d1836772-r797810591-Shangrila_Resort_Skardu-Skardu_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review797810591","travel_date":"2021-07","text":"Like everyone else, we bought into the beautiful pictures of the area and stayed here for 3 nights. Our experience fell way short of expectations.

The good thing is that the place is beautiful, and in the early hours of the day, when the entire circus of day visitors isn't allowed in, there are peaceful and enjoyable moments.

A ray of hope is the service staff. From very respectful waiters, servers, and room service professionals, everyone was very nice. If it were not for these people, we would have simply left.

On our arrival, we realized that the resort has a mismanaged entrance. Whether you are a guest who will be staying or throngs of visitors who drop in for a selfie, everyone's car has to go in the same entrance. This created an unnecessary bottleneck and wait for simply trying to get in. 

We had arrived at 12:20pm. Once inside, and at the reception, we waited for 15 minutes in an empty room before anyone would welcome us. The initial attitude of the staff was nonchalant. A simple question about where the nearest restrooms are located was answered with a sneer and we were pointed to some public restrooms (used by throngs of visitors). This would be a constant theme: the place does not provide any special treatment to guests who stay. Everyone, those paying thousands of rupees per night to stay and those who bought a ticket are treated equally. 

We were asked to wait until the 2:00pm checkin time. We were given one room (containing 1 of the 4 bedrooms we had booked), but for the other we were told stories about room not yet ready, someone else being in there, and an offer to move to another room half-way across the resort and offering only 1.4 more bedrooms. Upon on insistence that the reason we are paying all the money is for our family to be close and we getting the number of bedrooms we were promised, we were told to wait. One thing led to another, and after pathetic attempts, and a mismanaged scheduling system. we eventually got to enter our other room at 9pm, a cool 8 hours after we had arrived. I note that, the hotel had confirmed our arrival time several days in advance, and should have had a clear idea when we would arrive. The worse part is that while anywhere else in the world, and in any good reputable place, our room should have been comped, the person initially agreed and then refused to follow through with that compensation with the statement that "isn't the tea that we offered you good enough?"

The rooms are big, but have not seen an upgrade since the 1800s. The TV did'nt work. The internet stayed broken. The shower had two temperatures: ice cold & scalding hot; and two pressures: drip & fire hose.

The food is overpriced for what it is. Not necessarily bad, but not worth the price. There is a service charge, but I was told only 50% goes to the service people. There were bonfires on two of the nights we were there, which would have been enjoyable, but the presence of chain-smoking inconsiderate types that visit this establishment, made it not worth it.

BTW, none of the restaurants have restrooms nearby. So either make a long trek back to your room if nature calls, or use the disgusting public restrooms that didn't even have soap. Ugh!

The mismanagement and sense of entitlement present in this place is also evident from the fact that one night, all the restaurants were closed. On inquiry, we were told there is a private function, and all the hotel guests were asked to go to the Pagoda restaurant. The place can hold may be 3 parties, let alone handle the entire load of the guests. Again, a better managed place would have sent a note to all the guests, or informed the guests upon checkin that certain facilities will not be available on a specific day, and people can plan accordingly. But no, the show runners here are imbeciles, rather more accurately do not care a bit about the guests. The sense we got from the place was that they are doing us a favor for staying there.

Overall, the model here is one-off rip-off and not to earn repeat business.

Good: views
Bad: over priced 
Ugly: Despicably managed
verdict: visit, take a selfie, enjoy, DO NOT STAY The bathroom though was the absolute worst, we all showered with flip flops on AND there were big creepy crawlies (huge, multi legged insects) sharing the bathroom with you! The upside? The views were amazing as was the staff! I’ve read reviews complaining about the staff, I found them to be the nicest, most helpful people! Skardu Valley presents so much that can never be expressed in words and it all starts from the flight out of Islamabad when you are up and close to NANGA PARBATH (Killer Mountain) and all of its majesticness (I know this is not a word, but see it and try to find a word for it). Then you land in this beautiful serene Lower Kachura Valley to reach the resort. It will take a day at minimum just to get out of the awe of this place. Very picturesque and on top of that World's Best and Friendly Staff. Though wherever you will go around, you will find more and more friendly people eager to make your trip memorable more and more. But the best part of stay was receiving the fresh fruits plucked minutes ago and delivered to your room.
With already fixed rates you can hire the very good quality 4X4s to visit Upper Kachura Lake, Sokh Valley, Cold Desert, Safranga Desert, Kuplu Fort, Shigar Fort, Deosai Plains, Deosai Park, Chota Pani, Bara Pani, Mantoka Waterfall, and so so so many more. The drivers are complete guides who will make your trip to these places like a local and they will entertain you, guide you, explain you, and with their beautiful smile make it so much better. Abbas Bhai (our driver) is now a family friend and we are in contact even after the trip as they make you feel so welcome that you can never forget them.
I will not explain about the sights, and some so unique that you might not find any where in the world, but I will say only this, at least 5 days should be spent just to visit and cover the basic places, I prefer to have 7-9 nights so you can make it THE MOST MEMORABLE TRIP OF YOUR LIFETIME.","user":{"user_id":"5EB6FEE7C8C0C285E5F7CFD8E604F5D0","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"28","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"3","hotel_reviews":"12","attraction_reviews":"13","helpful_votes":"1","photos_count":"1","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"MRizwanSpeaks","user_location":{"name":"Dubai, United Arab Emirates","id":"295424"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/07/9b/e6/4a/rizwanamin.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-f/07/9b/e6/4a/rizwanamin.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.5EB6FEE7C8C0C285E5F7CFD8E604F5D0","points":"0","created_time":"2015-03-30T13:37:21-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Part of Heaven on Earth","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Value","value":"5"},{"name":"Location","value":"5"},{"name":"Service","value":"5"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false},{"id":"714982606","lang":"en","location_id":"1836772","published_date":"2019-10-03T06:09:37-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"3","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g317119-d1836772-r714982606-Shangrila_Resort_Skardu-Skardu_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review714982606","travel_date":"2018-12","text":"The experience of my stay at Shangrilla Resort, Skardu was outstanding. This resort is well spread over a large span of land. The rooms here are not confined in one building. Rather, there are small buildings of two separate rooms, with a gap between the buildings, because of which I enjoyed unbelievably privacy. As the Resort is spread over a large span of land, I enjoyed walking whenever I can out of the rooms which I had booked in advance. There is a small man-made lake in the centre of the entire land of this Resort. Tourists can enjoy boating in this man-made lake. The food sold in this Resort is rather expensive, but the taste and variety of the food sold here is well worth the price.","user":{"user_id":"9C247833EB387EFA9292377FC2EE80DF","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"3","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"0","hotel_reviews":"3","attraction_reviews":"0","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"0","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"Blackbeard1997","user_location":{"name":"Multan, Pakistan","id":"317117"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/e5/2b/default-avatar-2020-52.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/e5/2b/default-avatar-2020-52.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.9C247833EB387EFA9292377FC2EE80DF","points":"0","created_time":"2019-10-03T09:53:23-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Outstanding experience","owner_response":null,"subratings":[],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false},{"id":"703285096","lang":"en","location_id":"1836772","published_date":"2019-08-26T09:44:23-04:00","published_platform":"Mobile","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"2","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g317119-d1836772-r703285096-Shangrila_Resort_Skardu-Skardu_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review703285096","travel_date":"2019-08","text":"One of the most spectacular and serene valley we visited ever. [{"id":"816000809","lang":"en","location_id":"1027139","published_date":"2021-10-25T09:40:33-04:00","published_platform":"Mobile","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"1","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g469409-d1027139-r816000809-Eagle_s_Nest_Hotel-Hunza_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review816000809","travel_date":"2021-10","text":"We stayed one night at Eagle Nest Hotel.It was a very nice , pleasant and comfortable stay. The hotel is built on height and the view of Rakhaposhi mountain is speticular from the hotels and on other side could see the lady finger peak. We booked 2 rooms at their sister hotel at Eagle's Nest & paid in Advance to avoid any hassle since we were arriving late in the evening. 
Once we arrived tired from all days driving, the reception guy's first words were "you guys won't make it to the other hotel". Instead of welcoming they started to spit their lies about it's too hard to climb down the stairs for women at this hour & bla bla bla what not. Lies after lies after lies! 

After wasting our 1 hour & we insisting that we will go anyways since we had booked and paid for the duplex rooms. Finally they agreed to take us but just to give us more trouble & waste more of our time they had turned off all the lamps on the stairways so we wouldn't be able to go down. 
Luckily we had our own torch lights & decided to go down with only 2 people since by that time we already had suspected that they had given out our rooms to someone else. 

Long story short they took us through the hardest route to burn us just so we will not argue & stay at another horrible scary motel that nobody else was staying at. 

At the end we asked them to refund us the amount we paid & they refused to do so & not only that they threatened us with the consequences if we wouldn't leave. 

We ended up staying at the Serena hotel which we should've booked in the first place. 

I believe in supporting the local businesses but after this experience I'd recommend Boycotting this hotel to save your time, money and harrassment. You can tell the idea behind it is artistic, creative, luxury-resort oriented but somehow fell into the wrong hands. Starting with the room: nicely done but not maintained. No room service. Tv in our room did not work. Kept asking for someone to come and fix it for two nights but no one came. Then the balcony's light (which offers a heavenly view of the valley and the mountains) did not have the operating switch within the room??!! (strange). Called the reception to have it switched off - no one did that and the light remained on throughout our stay (3 days)!
My biggest issue was with the food! There is no nearby cafe for dinner (Eagle's Nest is wayyyy up a mountain), so if interested for dining out you have to go quite a way down - at the end of the day, everyone is too tired to do that. So from what I could gather hotel residents HAD to take dinner in its dining hall. And that is where the flaws show through. Food takes ages to arrive. Both nights we waited nearly 2 and more hours for as few as 4 dishes. Then very little serving per plate order. Lastly -pathetic food! We tried all the local dishes in other areas of GB as well and all tasted so much better. This is where they ought to have focused more and did not bother!
Surprisingly, the staff is mostly lounging about on the steps to the reception, reminds one of walking in an urban city bazaar, wary of leery eyed guys. Which is strange, as the GB locals are the sweetest, friendliest and quite egalitarian people.
The hotel seems to be surviving because of the view it offers but otherwise I do not think it will survive for long unless if the owners sit up and take notice.","user":{"user_id":"B44735D4FE3C39030C35AF454ABBBF3C","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"46","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"6","hotel_reviews":"15","attraction_reviews":"25","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"17","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"FDKamal","user_location":{"name":"Peshawar, Pakistan","id":"295412"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/0b/45/26/67/fdkamal.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-f/0b/45/26/67/fdkamal.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.B44735D4FE3C39030C35AF454ABBBF3C","points":"0","created_time":"2015-06-15T09:47:05-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Recommended for just the View","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Sleep Quality","value":"3"},{"name":"Cleanliness","value":"3"},{"name":"Service","value":"1"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false},{"id":"689343937","lang":"en","location_id":"1027139","published_date":"2019-07-13T16:45:06-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g469409-d1027139-r689343937-Eagle_s_Nest_Hotel-Hunza_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review689343937","travel_date":"2019-06","text":"When ever I visited hunza always stayed in eagle nest because the veiw and service of the hotel is amazing. The Villa itself was beautiful - international standard layout with 5 star luxury and amenities you expect from a name-brand property. Also note the great WiFi access and speed (no extra charge). I'd like to note we did a night away at Luxus in Attabad after all the instagram rave and were fairly disappointed with the service (and ambiance) received. We promptly returned back to Hard Rock Hunza for the remainder of our stay and were happy Irfan was able to accommodate us in such high rush season. We had travelled from skardu to Hunza & had stayed at the Serena’s in Khaplu & Shiger. Hence, the expectations from the Serena in Hunza. 
Upon arrival we were checked in to a super tiny room that couldn’t even fit our luggage in. We had to choose between walking around the bed or keeping our luggage. We requested for a bigger room and offered to pay for an upgrade but we were told there are only two deluxe rooms on the whole property which were completely booked. 
After complaining to them about their room & Internet, they gave us an excuse saying that since they can’t keep up to serena standards, they have named it Serena In. They are still charging the same price as Serena though. 
Nothing is good at this place. Don’t expect good food, services or hospitality. The people are reception don’t know how to deal with their clients & they have an excuse for everything. They are charging so much but can’t even provide good internet. On top of that, you don’t get good phone service in the area. 
This place only has a good view. That is all. But you can find that in many places in Hunza. 
I won’t recommend anyone to stay here and spend so much. [{"id":"769044221","lang":"en","location_id":"1085825","published_date":"2020-09-06T05:53:29-04:00","published_platform":"Mobile","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"0","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g7349278-d1085825-r769044221-Hunza_View_Hotel-Karimabad_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review769044221","travel_date":"2020-08","text":"Recently in August 2020 I visited Hunza, Gilgit Baltistan with a group of 23 people. There I stayed at Hunza view hotel.

Hunza view hotel. It is the all in one package a visitor like me could have wished for. Starting with it’s location, the hotel is surrounded by beautiful mountains from all sides. The view from the hotel is breathtaking and the hotel itself is so beautiful that you don’t have to go any where else. It has a lush green garden with trees of apple, peach, grapes and apricot.
The hotel has very sophisticated rooms by which I am pretty much satisfied. On to the management and hospitality. The hotel has a very good staff that is present at your service. Their Manager, Abbas is a hospitable, cooperative, friendly and a humble person who will always be there to assist you and give you the best piece of advice regarding your visit. The hotel also has it’s own parking area. 

But there are some areas where Hunza view hotel needs improvement. One of the area is cleaning, Although they provide you with the cleanings facility but it can only be done in the morning. It’s not 24/7. The other area is WiFi, the hotel has a weak WiFi connection and it gets difficult for the tourist to stay connected with the outside world. The alternative is to buy there local Sim network (SCOM).

Everything has it’s pros and cons but at the end of the day Hunza view hotel is my strongest recommendation to the people visiting Hunza, Gilgit It is the first hotel you would find as you enter into the steep road into Karimabad. 
Every room has its own balcony with stunning view on both sides. And there are common balconies on each wing of the hotel. So you have the best chance of capturing the beauty of Hunza Valley from this hotel.

Plus there is a garden with grapevines where you can just sit and enjoy the serene natural landscape and the lush greenery of Hunza Valley below. I was there in fall and simply the view is awesome!

At night in fall the temperature could drop to minus 4C. There was no heater in my room and hot water was very limited to certain hours in the morning. Fortunately, I had 2 warm blankets for the 3 nights I stayed here and I woke up at 5 am to get the first ration of hot water. 

Other amenities like a TV which I could live without. You would need to ask for housekeeping but I think it was not available at his hotel. I had to ask for a fresh towel. 

Not sure about cafeteria or restaurant in this hotel as my room was on the first floor. It looked like there was a small cafe on the third floor.

The lobby was quite impressive with a common TV room for guests and on the notice boards on the wall, you could find information about tours and day trips to around.Hunza Valley.

There was also a small souvenir shop next to the main entrance where you could get some local produce and sundries like mineral water etc.","user":{"user_id":"B442BCAEB0CF4924CF685AC7ABA4235F","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"171","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"23","hotel_reviews":"51","attraction_reviews":"97","helpful_votes":"0","photos_count":"194","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"marcofahmey","user_location":{"name":"Sao Paulo, SP","id":"303631"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/12/50/52/c7/marcofahmey.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-f/12/50/52/c7/marcofahmey.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.B442BCAEB0CF4924CF685AC7ABA4235F","points":"0","created_time":"2016-02-13T04:54:54-0500","locale":"en_MY"},"title":"A budget hotel with stunning views of the 5 peaks surrounding Hunza Valley","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Value","value":"3"},{"name":"Cleanliness","value":"2"},{"name":"Service","value":"3"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false}]

It is situated in the heart of KarimAbad (Central Hunza). Hunza is a very beautiful valley you should must visit once in a life. 
Mr. Maqbool is Best Of The Best Tour Operator & Tour Guide in Hunza & Pakistan. We spent 2 weeks with him in Pakistan & Hunza. He arranged our Trip and guided us in Pakistan. He is very Knowledgeable, polite, flexible, punctual, honest. We can frankly say that he is the university of history & Encyclopedia of Pakistan. We treated everywhere just like VIP guests on every monument in Pakistan. If anyone wants to visit Hunza or Pakistan contact him on his WhatsApp # +92-333-403 3331.

were 8 Cusin’s , from different cities of pakistan , on mid oct we arrived around 8 pm and tried to find the rooms , we arrived at the reception, and asked the price and wanted to check the rooms This local Shangrila is a located on a rise overlooking the Indus river below. 

It is a local, low-rise, sand-coloured hotel with quaint, cave-like rooms: the tables, chairs, bed stand are moulded rather than being separate pieces. Bright ethnic colours and fabic decorate the rooms, which have an unusual ventilator fan instead of air-conditioning for cooling.  The bathroom is covered in slate and can be a bit dark.  

There's an outdoor garden with a view overlooking the river and mountains across the river.  Dining area is long with glass windows on one side. 

The hotel is located away from the main town, but there are small hotels and restaurants within walking distance.  The main draw of this hotel is its location by the river and its local quaint-ness.

As at September 2018, there is some concern about security in the Chilas area, and the security guard won't let foreigners wander out of the hotel grounds unaccompanied by a guide.","user":{"user_id":"FD7FBA15378698541BADE5C784091E53","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"272","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"48","hotel_reviews":"167","attraction_reviews":"57","helpful_votes":"205","photos_count":"24","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"Leeyuk","user_location":{"name":"Kuala Lumpur","id":null},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/e6/ea/default-avatar-2020-54.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/e6/ea/default-avatar-2020-54.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.FD7FBA15378698541BADE5C784091E53","points":"0","created_time":"2006-09-22T02:18:37-0400","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Quaint and Engaging","owner_response":null,"subratings":[{"name":"Value","value":"4"},{"name":"Location","value":"4"},{"name":"Service","value":"3"}],"machine_translated":false,"machine_translatable":false},{"id":"602344421","lang":"en","location_id":"6847276","published_date":"2018-08-03T03:57:36-04:00","published_platform":"Desktop","rating":"5","type":"review","helpful_votes":"2","url":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g1652424-d6847276-r602344421-Shangrila_Resort_Hotel_Chilas-Chilas_Gilgit_Baltistan.html#review602344421","travel_date":"2018-06","text":"Shangrila resort hotel Chilas is a very impressive location on the banks of mighty River The Indus. Other guests were spread out as the seating areas were set up with plenty of space for families to enjoy the grand vistas. We had travelled from skardu to Hunza & had stayed at the Serena’s in Khaplu & Shiger. Hence, the expectations from the Serena in Hunza. 
Upon arrival we were checked in to a super tiny room that couldn’t even fit our luggage in. We had to choose between walking around the bed or keeping our luggage. We requested for a bigger room and offered to pay for an upgrade but we were told there are only two deluxe rooms on the whole property which were completely booked. 
After complaining to them about their room & Internet, they gave us an excuse saying that since they can’t keep up to serena standards, they have named it Serena In. They are still charging the same price as Serena though. 
Nothing is good at this place. Don’t expect good food, services or hospitality. The people are reception don’t know how to deal with their clients & they have an excuse for everything. They are charging so much but can’t even provide good internet. On top of that, you don’t get good phone service in the area. 
This place only has a good view. That is all. But you can find that in many places in Hunza. 
I won’t recommend anyone to stay here and spend so much. Irfan greeted us upon arrival and gave us a tour of the property and arranged for our welcome drinks (tumoro tea) all while our luggage was seamlessly transported to our private villa. The Villa itself was beautiful - international standard layout with 5 star luxury and amenities you expect from a name-brand property. Also note the great WiFi access and speed (no extra charge). We had a jam-packed schedule but always looked forward to returning to the hotel to enjoy our sunset tea and views from the hotel deck and our balcony. I'd like to note we did a night away at Luxus in Attabad after all the instagram rave and were fairly disappointed with the service (and ambiance) received. We promptly returned back to Hard Rock Hunza for the remainder of our stay and were happy Irfan was able to accommodate us in such high rush season. amenities: but quite charming. I enjoyed feeling as if I was somewhere I’d never find in my home country. The beds are built on a clay platform. Lots of warm bedding. Clay pots used as lamps shine with red and green lamps. Lots of hot water.

We were here for three nights, and enjoyed the comfortable rooms, clean facilities, beautiful grounds, and excellent service. 

This was first of our 5 hotels-stay in our GB tour, and set a high bar for everyone. From the professional and friendly check-in, to immediate availability of our rooms, nice views, and beautifully manicured grounds, this is a must-have experience. 

The place has among the most cozy comforters that I have used at a hotel. The ACs worked very well, though are not needed much. The washrooms are well equipped but the showers were on the smaller side. I was told that renovations are being done, and that the newer rooms have somewhat bigger showers etc. 

Everyone here is amazingly friendly, and made us feel as if we were at home. I know it is the norm at some places, but the staff brining us three kinds of teas we asked for as well as fresh breads etc. made us feel very welcome. 

The third-floor restaurant that hosted the breakfast buffet offers beautiful views. The manager Mr. Karim checked on us (and other guests) personally, which is a nice touch and very appreciated. 

While I’d guess that many stay here while on their way to Hunza etc., the place can certainly be a destination on its own—a respite from the heat in summer while enjoying the great hospitality. 

Go stay here, enjoy the facilities and views. I know I'll be doing that again when I revisit.","user":{"user_id":"A790A95B3D5A41A78BA67A6052A671E3","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"44","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"9","hotel_reviews":"23","attraction_reviews":"12","helpful_votes":"31","photos_count":"38","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"EatTravelLive","user_location":{"name":"Blacksburg, Virginia","id":"57513"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/ec/3d/default-avatar-2020-1.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/ec/3d/default-avatar-2020-1.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.A790A95B3D5A41A78BA67A6052A671E3","points":"0","created_time":"2009-12-01T14:26:05-0500","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Beautiful and comfortable place to stay in Gilgit.","owner_response":{"id":"799827652","lang":"en","published_date":"2021-07-25T23:22:22-04:00","connection":"General Manager","responder":"Sarwat Majeed","text":"Dear Guest,

We were here for three nights, and enjoyed the comfortable rooms, clean facilities, beautiful grounds, and excellent service. 

This was first of our 5 hotels-stay in our GB tour, and set a high bar for everyone. From the professional and friendly check-in, to immediate availability of our rooms, nice views, and beautifully manicured grounds, this is a must-have experience. 

The place has among the most cozy comforters that I have used at a hotel. The ACs worked very well, though are not needed much. The washrooms are well equipped but the showers were on the smaller side. I was told that renovations are being done, and that the newer rooms have somewhat bigger showers etc. 

Everyone here is amazingly friendly, and made us feel as if we were at home. I know it is the norm at some places, but the staff brining us three kinds of teas we asked for as well as fresh breads etc. made us feel very welcome. 

The third-floor restaurant that hosted the breakfast buffet offers beautiful views. The manager Mr. Karim checked on us (and other guests) personally, which is a nice touch and very appreciated. 

While I’d guess that many stay here while on their way to Hunza etc., the place can certainly be a destination on its own—a respite from the heat in summer while enjoying the great hospitality. 

Go stay here, enjoy the facilities and views. I know I'll be doing that again when I revisit.","user":{"user_id":"A790A95B3D5A41A78BA67A6052A671E3","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"44","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"9","hotel_reviews":"23","attraction_reviews":"12","helpful_votes":"31","photos_count":"38","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"EatTravelLive","user_location":{"name":"Blacksburg, Virginia","id":"57513"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/ec/3d/default-avatar-2020-1.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/ec/3d/default-avatar-2020-1.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.A790A95B3D5A41A78BA67A6052A671E3","points":"0","created_time":"2009-12-01T14:26:05-0500","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Beautiful and comfortable place to stay in Gilgit.","owner_response":{"id":"799827652","lang":"en","published_date":"2021-07-25T23:22:22-04:00","connection":"General Manager","responder":"Sarwat Majeed","text":"Dear Guest,

We were here for three nights, and enjoyed the comfortable rooms, clean facilities, beautiful grounds, and excellent service. 

This was first of our 5 hotels-stay in our GB tour, and set a high bar for everyone. From the professional and friendly check-in, to immediate availability of our rooms, nice views, and beautifully manicured grounds, this is a must-have experience. 

The place has among the most cozy comforters that I have used at a hotel. The ACs worked very well, though are not needed much. The washrooms are well equipped but the showers were on the smaller side. I was told that renovations are being done, and that the newer rooms have somewhat bigger showers etc. 

Everyone here is amazingly friendly, and made us feel as if we were at home. I know it is the norm at some places, but the staff brining us three kinds of teas we asked for as well as fresh breads etc. made us feel very welcome. 

The third-floor restaurant that hosted the breakfast buffet offers beautiful views. The manager Mr. Karim checked on us (and other guests) personally, which is a nice touch and very appreciated. 

While I’d guess that many stay here while on their way to Hunza etc., the place can certainly be a destination on its own—a respite from the heat in summer while enjoying the great hospitality. 

Go stay here, enjoy the facilities and views. I know I'll be doing that again when I revisit.","user":{"user_id":"A790A95B3D5A41A78BA67A6052A671E3","type":"user","first_name":null,"last_initial":null,"name":null,"reviewer_type":null,"contributions":{"reviews":"44","review_city_count":"0","restaurant_reviews":"9","hotel_reviews":"23","attraction_reviews":"12","helpful_votes":"31","photos_count":"38","badges_count":"0"},"member_id":"0","username":"EatTravelLive","user_location":{"name":"Blacksburg, Virginia","id":"57513"},"avatar":{"small":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/ec/3d/default-avatar-2020-1.jpg"},"large":{"url":"https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-l/1a/f6/ec/3d/default-avatar-2020-1.jpg"}},"link":"https://www.tripadvisor.com/MemberProfile-a_uid.A790A95B3D5A41A78BA67A6052A671E3","points":"0","created_time":"2009-12-01T14:26:05-0500","locale":"en_US"},"title":"Beautiful and comfortable place to stay in Gilgit.","owner_response":{"id":"799827652","lang":"en","published_date":"2021-07-25T23:22:22-04:00","connection":"General Manager","responder":"Sarwat Majeed","text":"Dear Guest,
